title: 107_hr344
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001" eliminates the 5-month waiting period for disability benefits. The Social Security Disability Waiting Period Elimination Act of 2001 removes the waiting period for disability insurance benefits. Amendments are made to section 223(a)(1) and 223(a)(2) of the Social Security Act to adjust the eligibility criteria for receiving benefits. Amendments are made to section 223(a)(2) of the Social Security Act, removing defined terms and adjusting the eligibility criteria for receiving benefits. Amendments are made to widow's and widower's insurance benefits based on disability under the Social Security Act, including the elimination of defined terms and adjustments to eligibility criteria. Amendments to widow's and widower's insurance benefits under the Social Security Act include the elimination of a defined term and adjustments to eligibility criteria. Section 202(f) of the Act is amended by removing a paragraph and redesignating others. Elimination of waiting period for disability and Medicare benefits under the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to Section 226(b) of the Social Security Act, removing the waiting period requirement for disability and Medicare benefits. Key changes include removing the 24-month entitlement requirement and adjusting the criteria for eligibility. Amendments to various sections of the Social Security Act and Medicare description are made, removing the 24-month entitlement requirement for benefits and adjusting eligibility criteria. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by this Act apply to Social Security benefits based on disability and applications for disability determinations filed under title II of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this Act apply to insurance benefits under title XVIII of the Social Security Act for items and services provided at least 90 days after the enactment of the Act.
